dcterms:creator: J. Foox
B. Pan
L. M. Schriml
D. J. Stekhoven
S. Mangul
N. Beerenwinkel
dcterms:description: Technical replicates of the Ashkenazi Jewish Trio dataset were generated to assess the performance of DNA sequencing platforms, involving triplicates of inter-laboratory and intra-laboratory paired-end and single-end DNA-seq samples using multiple platforms.
dcterms:title: Ashkenazi Jewish Trio

dcterms:creator: B. Pan
dcterms:description: The Chinese Quartet dataset consists of technical replicates generated for structural variant detection studies, sequenced from three different labs as triplicates representing different runs of sequencing.
dcterms:title: Chinese Quartet

dcterms:creator: B. Pan
dcterms:description: The HapMap Trio dataset is used for structural variant calling studies to examine reproducibility across various factors, including sequencing platforms and alignment tools.
dcterms:title: HapMap Trio

dcterms:creator: B. Pan
dcterms:description: The Genome in a Bottle (GIAB) dataset serves as a reference for evaluating genomic reproducibility in various studies.
dcterms:title: Genome in a Bottle (GIAB)

dcterms:creator: B. Pan
dcterms:description: The NA12878 dataset is utilized in structural variant calling studies to examine reproducibility across various factors, including sequencing platforms and alignment tools.
dcterms:title: NA12878

dcterms:creator: S.-I. Consortium
dcterms:description: The RNA-seq dataset from the SEQC consortium has been employed to assess the reproducibility of RNA-seq experiments and the impact of RNA-seq data analysis tools on gene expression analysis.
dcterms:title: RNA-seq dataset from the SEQC consortium
